title: Sadly Not From The Onion - Texas GOP Against Thinking & Voting Rights

comments.text:
Negroes had the vote in America from 1870, women from 1920. That said, the 
former depended on where you lived. Most negroes were were Republican 
voters until the 1930's. I wish America and Britain had the same education 
system as Singapore.﻿
comments.author: CHris Henniker

comments.text: #FREEDUMB  ﻿

comments.text:
I know what to say about this.
This is our stinking fault.
Get it right folks, We THE PEOPLE have the power to vote in and vote out 
any person WE want to.

Stop sitting around with your thumb in your mouth and let's vote these 
STUPID fools out of office.
Let's get back to our roots, and let's stop dumbing down America.﻿
comments.author: James Bradley

comments.text:
What gets me really angry is what Cenk is saying about the democrats , they 
are such pussies, They let those nutjob republicans walk all overt them and 
bully them. For fuck sake the only democrat with any balls is Elizabeth 
Warren  Democrat legislators will you grow a pair.﻿
comments.author: tom johnson

comments.text:
We wouldn't HAVE to undermine parental authority if parents actually RAISED 
their kids to have the mental CAPACITY of developing their own opinions, 
and RESPECT for people who disagree with them.

Oh, and those who want to say, "But thinking freely means violence and 
anarchy!"... Thinking logically begets non-prejudice, learning that we're 
all from the same source. "Do to others what you'd want done to you." Oh 
right, that's a BIBLE verse. :3

And yet there's no verse that says, "Hell is infinite pain for any sin and 
burns forever", no matter how hell-believing you are.﻿
comments.author: MothJosh

comments.text:
Their issues with the Voting rights-act was the Pre-clearance stuff. Which 
was found unconstitutional because it failed to specify how long a state 
had to be clean and what standards of evidence the Federal DOJ needed to 
deny a voting rules change.﻿
comments.author: DIEGhostfish

comments.text:
That whole bit about Republicans opposing critical thinking is taken out of 
context.  They were talking specifically about standardized testing, which 
is becoming an enormous issue in Texas.  Standardized testing is being used 
as a weapon against schools and students.  A student getting a perfect 
grade on the standardized test does not help a student who failed a class 
in any way.  But a student who aces their classes and then fails the 
standardized test still cannot graduate.  That's right.  Student who pass 
all of their classes with flying colors will not be able to graduate.  This 
is happening right now in Texas.  Republicans aren't against higher 
learning, they are against students who work hard and pass their classes 
not getting to graduate.﻿
comments.author: David Hudson

comments.text:
As a Kansan, it's worrisome that in the past our Governor Sam Brownback in 
the past has stated he wanted Kansas to be more like Texas.  As a land 
locked State with far less  carbon based energy resources as Texas that's 
impossible in regards to economics.  However in matters like this is 
entirely possible for this to take place in Kansas. Gradually the saner 
Christians are loosing their grip economically.﻿
comments.author: waswestkan

comments.text:
You know, the Democratic party is also a national embarrasment. 'If the

more than two sides to every tale, but a two-party system polarizes it. 
Even TDR failed to break it. Sucks. Which side f's me less?

closed-minded views. And fuck Valve for not making Half-Life 3. Ya know?!

comments.text:
I don't have a problem with conservativism or liberalism. I just have a 
problem with conservatives and liberals. Why can't we just make a system 
that lets liberals be liberal and conservatives be conservative?

comments.text:

I don't think that the Texas GOP is composed of racists. I don't think they 
want to stop blacks from voting. I don't think that they want to remove the 
"Voter Rights Act" and the ramifications. I think they want to remove it

overreach of federal power and places unwarranted bureaucratic demands on 
Southern states that have long since abandoned the discrimination it was 
meant to eradicate. I think that they trust the country.

comments.text:

designed to take you out of conservatism and Christianity) are bad.
